title: Fire!
content:
Hello,

Does anyone know of a dingbat or something related to fire, flames, sparks, combustion or anything of that nature.

Thanks.
author: James Eden

comments.content: Sounds like something that [Rian Hughes](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rian%20Hughes) would do... (sorry, I'm not helping here)

youworkforthem.com has two fire vector sets, but im not sure if they are what you are looking for.

[http://youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=E0037](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=E0037)  
 [http://youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=E0038](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=E0038)
i'm sure veer has some type that fits your description, but i can't seem to get the search function to work tonite...
you might like the [pyrobats](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/66.39.19.127/archives/000025.html) from smoking drum

[Linotype Warning Pi](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/warning-pi/)  
[Edit: Oops, just noticed it has been suggested already...]

james,

This should do it!? Fire symbols all over the place.

[http://www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/pyrotechnics1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804232843/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/pyrotechnics1.html "http://www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/pyrotechnics1.html")

Good luck!
Sorry about the lower case "j" btw.

Cheers Stefan.

I always use the lc j.
aha! that test pilot stuff was what i was looking for on veer.
